metadata.title: CVE-2024-26582 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:tls: fix use-after-free with partial reads and async decrypt tls_decrypt_sgdoesn't take a reference on the pages from clear_skb, so the put_page() intls_decrypt_done releases them, and we trigger a use-after-free inprocess_rx_list when we try to read from the partially-read skb.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26582` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
